metadata.title: CVE-2023-26590 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A floating point exception vulnerability was found in sox, in thelsx_aiffstartwrite function at sox/src/aiff.c:622:58. This flaw can lead toa denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
libsox3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
sox - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.22.04.1').
